title: 108_s1582
content:
The Valles Caldera Preservation Act of 2004 may be cited as the "Valles Caldera Preservation Act." Amendments to the Act are outlined in Section 2. The Valles Caldera Preservation Act of 2004 is amended to allow the acquisition of mineral interests with available funds. If negotiations fail, the Secretary can acquire the interests through a declaration of taking. The Valles Caldera Preservation Act is amended to allow the acquisition of mineral interests with available funds. The Trust determines obligations and expenditures, and can solicit donations. The Valles Caldera Preservation Act is amended to allow specific members of the Board of Trustees and employees to solicit donations. Additionally, proceeds from claims, judgments, or settlements related to activities on the Baca Ranch or the Preserve after October 27, 1999, can be used. Additionally, proceeds from claims, judgments, or settlements related to activities on the Baca Ranch or the Preserve after October 27, 1999, can be used. SEC. 3. BOARD OF TRUSTEES. Section 107(e) of the Valles Caldera Preservation Act is amended to specify the selection and compensation of trustees, with the chair being able to receive compensation not exceeding a certain rate. The chair's compensation for a fiscal year under the Valles Caldera Preservation Act shall not exceed 25 percent of the annual rate of pay for level IV of the Executive Schedule. SEC. 4. RESOURCE MANAGEMENT. (a) Property Disposal Limitations amended to include exclusions for real property disposal, excluding forage, forest products, or marketable renewable resources. 
(b) Law Enforcement and Fire Management section amended for better clarity on law enforcement responsibilities. The paragraph discusses amendments to the Law Enforcement and Fire Management section, specifying responsibilities for law enforcement and fire management on the Preserve. The amendments include developing a plan for fire preparedness, suppression, and emergency rehabilitation services in consultation with the Trust. The plan for fire preparedness, suppression, and emergency rehabilitation services on the Preserve will be developed in consultation with the Trust under a cooperative agreement with the Secretary. Reimbursable services may also be provided by the Secretary for the Trust on a reimbursable basis. The Senate passed the bill on September 15, 2004. Attest: EMILY J. REYNOLDS, Secretary.
